post.summary: Search for users in an organization
post.description:
**The API is available for customers using the new user management experience only. [How the new user management experience works](https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Atlassian-Access-articles/User-management-for-cloud-admins-just-got-easier/ba-p/1576592)**

Returns a list of users within an organization, offering search functionality through multiple parameters for more precise results.

200.description: Organization found. Response contains user search results

400.description:
Bad request

Expected values for `ApplicationError.code`: (see type description for details)
- `ADMIN-400-24`

Unauthorized

Expected values for `ProxyError.code`: (see type description for details)

Too many API requests

get.description: Returns a page of users in an organization that match the supplied parameters.

200.description: Returned if the request is successful.

400.description: Returned if the request is not in correct format.

401.description: Returned if the requestor is not authenticated.

404.description: Returned if the organization ID or directory ID is not found.

429.description: Returned if the API rate limit is reached.

get.description:
Returns a filtered list of audit log events for an organization. Use this endpoint for more granular and detailed querying. 
If you simply need to paginate through all events, consider using the [/events-stream](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/rest/api-group-events/#api-v1-orgs-orgid-events-stream-get) endpoint.  
These rate limits for this endpoint be lowered effective end of May 2025 as follows:
 - *Rate limit per user*: *10* requests per minute
 - *Rate limit per API path*: *10* requests per minute

 Please migrate to the polling API to guarantee uninterrupted service for use cases involving a high request rate.

#### Scopes
**[OAuth 2.0 scopes](/cloud/admin/scopes/) required:** **`Not supported (use API Key without scopes)`**

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Sets the starting point for the page of results to return

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Single query term for searching events.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The earliest date and time of the event represented as a UNIX epoch time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The latest date and time of the event represented as a UNIX epoch time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: A query filter that returns events of a specific action type.

parameters.name: actor
parameters.description: A query filter that returns events by one or more specific actors.

parameters.name: ip
parameters.description: A query filter that returns events by one or more specific ip addresses.

parameters.name: product
parameters.description: A query filter that returns events by one or more specific products.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: A query filter that returns events by one or more specific locations. Of format: [ { "city": "<CityName>", "countryName": "<CountryName>" }, ... ]

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of events to return per page.

200.description: Successful operation

400.description: Invalid request parameters

get.description:
Returns a paginated list of audit logs events for an organization. Use this endpoint if you want to retrieve events in a simple, paginated manner with time-based filtering.
If you need more advanced filtering, refer to the [/events](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/rest/api-group-events/#api-v1-orgs-orgid-events-get) endpoint.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Sets the starting point for the page of results to return. Can be used when last page is reached to poll for new events. The sort order is maintained in the cursor across requests.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The earliest date and time of the event represented as a UNIX epoch time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The latest date and time of the event represented as a UNIX epoch time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of events to return per page.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: The order used to sort events by processing time. Defaults to ascending.

200.description: Successful operation

400.description: Invalid request parameters

get.description: Returns information about a single event by ID.

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: ID of the event to return

200.description: Successful operation

404.description: Event or Org Not Found

get.description:
**Additional response parameters of the API (for e.g., `added_to_org`) are available only to customers using the new user management experience.** Learn more about the [new user management experience](https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Atlassian-Access-articles/User-management-for-cloud-admins-just-got-easier/ba-p/1576592).

Specifications:
- Return a user’s last active date for each product listed in Atlassian Administration.
- Active is defined as viewing a product's page for a minimum of 2 seconds. 
- The data for the last activity may be delayed by up to 24 hours.
- If the user has not accessed a product, the `product_access` response field will be empty. 

Learn the fastest way to call the API with a detailed [tutorial](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/user-last-active-dates/).

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
Unique ID of the user's account.
Use the [Jira User Search API](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-users/#api-rest-api-3-users-search-get) to get the accountId (if Jira is available for your Organization). **Jira APIs use a different [authentication method ](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/basic-auth-for-rest-apis/).**
If you don’t have Jira, export a .csv of the user list. Learn how to [export users from a site](https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/export-users-from-a-site/).

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor to fetch the next page

delete.description:
**The API is available for customers using the new user management experience only.** Learn more about the [new user management experience](https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Atlassian-Access-articles/User-management-for-cloud-admins-just-got-easier/ba-p/1576592).

Specifications:
- Remove user access to products listed in Atlassian Administration.
- Remove users from **Users** and **Groups** in **Directory**.
- Make product licenses available for active users.

The users are not removed immediately; instead, they are placed in a queue for deletion. Please note that it may take some time for all users to be completely removed.

Users with emails whose domain is claimed can still be found in **Managed accounts** in **Directory**.

Learn the fastest way to call the API with a detailed [tutorial](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/remove-user/).

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
Unique ID of the user's account that you are deleting.
Use the [Jira User Search API](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-users/#api-rest-api-3-users-search-get) to get the accountId (if Jira is available for your Organization). **Jira APIs use a different [authentication method ](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/basic-auth-for-rest-apis/).**
If you don’t have Jira, export a .csv of the user list. Learn how to [export users from a site](https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/export-users-from-a-site/).

204.description: User access removed from organization. Everything went fine, nothing to return. The users are not removed immediately; instead, they are placed in a queue for deletion. Please note that it may take some time for all users to be completely removed.

400.description:
Bad request

Expected values for `ApplicationError.code`: (see type description for details)
- `ADMIN-400-4`

401.description:
Unauthorized

Expected values for `ApplicationError.code`: (see type description for details)
  - `ADMIN-401-2`

Expected values for `ProxyError.code`: (see type description for details)
  - `401`

Expected values for `ApplicationError.code`: (see type description for details)
- `ADMIN-403-3`

Too many API requests

post.description:
**The API is available for customers using the new user management experience only.** Learn more about the [new user management experience](https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Atlassian-Access-articles/User-management-for-cloud-admins-just-got-easier/ba-p/1576592).

Specifications:
- Suspend user access to products listed in Atlassian Administration while keeping the account active. 
- Make product licenses available for active users.
- Maintain respective users in **Groups** for easy restoration.

User access can be restored anytime via the [Restore access API](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/rest/api-group-directory/#api-v1-orgs-orgid-directory-users-accountid-restore-access-post)

Learn the fastest way to call the API with a detailed [tutorial](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/suspend-user/).

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
Unique ID of the user's account that you are suspending.
Use the [Jira User Search API](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-users/#api-rest-api-3-users-search-get) to get the accountId (if Jira is available for your Organization). **Jira APIs use a different [authentication method ](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/basic-auth-for-rest-apis/).**
If you don’t have Jira, export a .csv of the user list. Learn how to [export users from a site](https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/export-users-from-a-site/).

200.description: User was successfully suspended in the organization directory.

message.example: Access to organization 6665kc2j-4644-14k8-j32c-68cc0b1d15b8 was suspended for user 637194fa77acd224b33bfae3
message.description: A description of the entities affected, and changes made as a result of calling this API.

post.description:
**The API is available for customers using the new user management experience only.** Learn more about the [new user management experience](https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Atlassian-Access-articles/User-management-for-cloud-admins-just-got-easier/ba-p/1576592).

This API will:
- Restore access of an existing user to products listed in Atlassian Administration.
- Retract the suspend user action.

This API will not:
- Restore access to a user when they have access to a product which is breaching it's license limit.\
To make these changes, you will need to [remove users](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/rest/api-group-directory/#api-v1-orgs-orgid-directory-groups-groupid-memberships-accountid-delete) from the group or 
[suspend users](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/rest/api-group-directory/#api-v1-orgs-orgid-directory-users-accountid-suspend-access-post) that are in the group first.\
You can also [manage your subscription](https://support.atlassian.com/subscriptions-and-billing/resources/) for the breaching product to increase your license limits.
- Restore access to any user when your organisation has too many products that are breaching their license limits.

Learn the fastest way to call the API with a detailed [tutorial](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/restore-user/).

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
Unique ID of the user's account that you are suspending.
Use the [Jira User Search API](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-users/#api-rest-api-3-users-search-get) to get the accountId (if Jira is available for your Organization). **Jira APIs use a different [authentication method ](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/basic-auth-for-rest-apis/).**
If you don’t have Jira, export a .csv of the user list. Learn how to [export users from a site](https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/export-users-from-a-site/).

200.description: User's access is successfully restored in the organization directory.

message.example: Access to organization 6665kc2j-4644-14k8-j32c-68cc0b1d15b8 was restored for user 637194fa77acd224b33bfae3
message.description: A description of the entities affected, and changes made as a result of calling this API.

post.description:
**The API is available for customers using the new user management experience only. Learn more about the [new user management experience](https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Atlassian-Access-articles/User-management-for-cloud-admins-just-got-easier/ba-p/1576592).**

This API will:
- Create a group in the organization's directory.
- Create a collection of users that you can use to easily manage permissions, content access, notification schemes, and roles.

**The creation of new groups using existing group names is not permitted.**

Learn the fastest way to call the API with a detailed [tutorial](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/create-group/#create-group).

200.description: Request to create group was successfully accepted and will be eventually created in the organization directory.

message.description: A description of the entities affected, and changes made as a result of calling this API.

delete.description:
**The API is available for customers using the new user management experience only. Learn more about the [new user management experience](https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Atlassian-Access-articles/User-management-for-cloud-admins-just-got-easier/ba-p/1576592).**

This API will:
- Delete a group from the organization's directory.
- Delete the permissions, content access, notification schemes, and roles granted to the users.

This API will not:
- Delete groups that are synchronized through SCIM. To delete these groups, you will need to delete them within your external identity provider. Learn more about [configuring user provisioning with an identity provider](https://support.atlassian.com/provisioning-users/docs/configure-user-provisioning-with-an-identity-provider/).
- Delete a group if it’s marked as a [default group](https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/default-groups-and-permissions).
- Delete `site-admin` group and therefore revoke org-admin role from a user.
- Delete a group if it contains users (unless forced).

Learn the fastest way to call the API with a detailed [tutorial](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/delete-group/#delete-group).

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description:
Unique ID that serves as reference to the group.
Use the [Jira Group Search API](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-groups/#api-rest-api-3-groups-picker-get) to get the groupId (if Jira is available for your Organization). **Jira APIs use a different [authentication method ](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/basic-auth-for-rest-apis/).**
If you don’t have Jira, export a .csv of the user list. Make sure to select **pivot to column** when prompted. Learn how to [export users from a site](https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/export-users-from-a-site/).

parameters.name: forceIfNotEmpty
parameters.description: Groups cannot be deleted if it contains users, unless `forceIfNotEmpty=true` is provided

200.description: Group was successfully deleted from organization's directory.

post.description:
**The API is available for customers using the new user management experience only. Learn more about the [new user management experience](https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Atlassian-Access-articles/User-management-for-cloud-admins-just-got-easier/ba-p/1576592).**

This API will:
- Add user to a group.
- Assign multiple permissions to user at once.
- Easily manage permissions, content access, notification schemes, and roles.

This API will not:
- Make modifications to group memberships that are synchronized through SCIM. To make changes to these memberships, you will need to modify them within your external identity provider. Learn more about [configuring user provisioning with an identity provider](https://support.atlassian.com/provisioning-users/docs/configure-user-provisioning-with-an-identity-provider/).
- Add a user to a group that gives access to a product which is breaching it's license limit.\
To make these changes, you will need to [remove users](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/rest/api-group-directory/#api-v1-orgs-orgid-directory-groups-groupid-memberships-accountid-delete) from the group or
[suspend users](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/rest/api-group-directory/#api-v1-orgs-orgid-directory-users-accountid-suspend-access-post) that are in the group first.\
You can also [manage your subscription](https://support.atlassian.com/subscriptions-and-billing/resources/) for the breaching product to increase your license limits.
- Add a user to any group when your organisation has too many products that are breaching their license limits.

Learn the fastest way to call the API with a detailed [tutorial](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/add-user-to-group/).

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description:
Unique ID that serves as reference to the group.
Use the [Jira Group Search API](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-groups/#api-rest-api-3-groups-picker-get) to get the groupId (if Jira is available for your Organization). **Jira APIs use a different [authentication method ](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/basic-auth-for-rest-apis/).**
If you don’t have Jira, export a .csv of the user list. Make sure to select **pivot to column** when prompted. Learn how to [export users from a site](https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/export-users-from-a-site/).

200.description: User was successfully added to the group in the organization directory.

message.description: A description of the entities affected, and changes made as a result of calling this API.

- `ADMIN-400-24`
- `ADMIN-400-32`

delete.description:
**The API is available for customers using the new user management experience only. Learn more about the [new user management experience](https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Atlassian-Access-articles/User-management-for-cloud-admins-just-got-easier/ba-p/1576592).**

This API will:
- Remove user from a group.
- Remove multiple permissions for user at once.
- Easily manage permissions, content access, notification schemes, and roles.

This API will not:
- Make modifications to group memberships that are synchronized through SCIM. To make changes to these memberships, you will need to modify them within your external identity provider. Learn more about [configuring user provisioning with an identity provider](https://support.atlassian.com/provisioning-users/docs/configure-user-provisioning-with-an-identity-provider/).
- Modify `site-admin` group and therefore revoke org-admin role from a user.

Learn the fastest way to call the API with a detailed [tutorial](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/remove-user-to-group/).

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description:
Unique ID that serves as reference to the group.
Use the [Jira Group Search API](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-groups/#api-rest-api-3-groups-picker-get) to get the groupId (if Jira is available for your Organization). **Jira APIs use a different [authentication method ](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/basic-auth-for-rest-apis/).**
If you don’t have Jira, export a .csv of the user list. Make sure to select **pivot to column** when prompted. Learn how to [export users from a site](https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/export-users-from-a-site/).

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
Unique ID of the user's account that you are adding to the group.
Use the [Jira User Search API](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-users/#api-rest-api-3-users-search-get) to get the accountId (if Jira is available for your Organization). **Jira APIs use a different [authentication method ](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/basic-auth-for-rest-apis/).**
If you don’t have Jira, export a .csv of the user list. Learn how to [export users from a site](https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/export-users-from-a-site/).

200.description: User was successfully removed from the group in the organization directory.

message.example: User 63ec0aa0c5061c632c0cddde was removed from group fca77b90-a2a9-4385-961b-1377b3dbeb0b

- assign a role for a given resource

This API will not:

post.description:
A workspace refers to a specific instance of an Atlassian product that is accessed through a unique URL. Whenever a user initiates or adds a new product instance, it results in the creation of a distinct workspace.

This API will:
- Return a paginated list of workspaces in a given org
- Return more details about an organization's products (including product URL).

documents.title: About
documents.body:
The Organizations REST API provides resources for managing an Atlassian organization. Use this API to:
- Get a list of users in an organization and update their access to products
- Create and update organization policies
- Get lists of domains and events

Permission: Organization admin

[Discover additional admin features](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/rest-apis/)

documents.title: Authentication
documents.body:
Authentication is implemented via an API key. Use the API Key as a Bearer access token to authenticate the script and manage your organization. The Organization ID is used as a unique identifier in the path parameter for the organization. Copy the Organization ID and API key and keep them in a safe place. We won’t show them to you again.

To make requests to the API with the client/tool of your choice, [Create an API key and get the organization ID](https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/manage-an-organization-with-the-admin-apis/).

documents.title: Rate limits
documents.body:
A rate limit defines the maximum number of API calls an application or user can perform during a specific time frame. When this threshold is surpassed, or if CPU or total time constraints are exceeded, the application or user might encounter delays. Consequently, API requests initiated by the user or application will not succeed.

It is essential to note that all API requests are subjected to rate limits.

When a client breach the rate limit thresholds, they get [HTTP 429 Too Many Requests](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6585#section-4) responses. The client has to wait for the rate limit counter to reset on the server before being able to make successful requests.

**Rate limit response headers**

The following HTTP response headers are returned indicating the rate and threshold allowed for a client for each endpoint.
- **X-RateLimit-Limit:** The number of allowed requests in the current period
- **X-RateLimit-Remaining:** The number of remaining requests in the current period
- **X-RateLimit-Reset:** Next period reset time (ISO 8601 - Date and time in UTC)

**Rate limits of Events API**

Rate limits for the following endpoints is specified below: 

- `GET /v1/orgs/{orgId}/events`
- `GET /v1/orgs/{orgId}/events/{eventId}`
- `GET /v1/orgs/{orgId}/event-actions`

- *Rate limit per user*: *60* requests per minute
- *Rate limit per API path*: *50* requests per minute

These rate limits will be lowered effective end of May 2025 as follows:

- *Rate limit per user*: *10* requests per minute
- *Rate limit per API path*: *10* requests per minute

Please migrate to the polling API to guarantee uninterrupted service for use cases involving a high request rate.

**Rate limits of Polling API**

Rate limits for the following endpoints is specified below: 

- `GET /v1/orgs/{orgId}/events-stream`

- *Rate limit per user*: *60* requests per minute
- *Rate limit per API path*: *50* requests per minute

documents.title: Version and URI
documents.body:
The URIs for resources have the following structure:

```
https://api.atlassian.com/admin/<version>/orgs/<resource-name>
```

documents.title: Pagination
documents.body: The Organizations REST API uses pagination to conserve server resources and limit response size. If there are more results available after the current page, a link to the next page of results is included in the JSON. You can use the `cursor` parameter to set a specific starting point for the results.

documents.title: Experimental features
documents.body: Methods marked as experimental may change without an earlier notice. We are looking for your feedback for these methods.

documents.title: Vocabulary
documents.body: There are several concepts that are common ideas with a unique meaning in Atlassian Administration. Learn more about [terminology](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/cloud-admin-vocabulary/) related to the cloud admin experience.

Error.Unauthorized.description: The consumer could not be authenticated.

domains.description: Link to the related Domains of the Org

users.description: Link to the related Users of the Org

data.description: 0 or more values of `Org` are returned

last_active.description: Last active date for a product

id.description: Unique ID of the Product instance

last_active.description: Last active date for a product

account_id.description: Unique ID of the users account. The format is [a-zA-Z0-9_|-:]{1,128}

account_status.description: The lifecycle status of the account

name.description: The display name of the user. Should be used for contextual rendering of the authorship in content. If the user has restricted visibility of their name, their nickname will be displayed as a substitute value

picture.description: The absolute URI (RFC3986) to the avatar name of the user. Should be used for contextual rendering of the authorship in content. If the user has restricted visibility of their avatar, an alternative URI will be provided as a substitute value

email.description: The email address of the user. If the user has restricted visibility of the email address, the property will be absent

access_billable.description: Billable status of User in Atlassian Guard Standard

last_active.description: Last active date for a user

product_access.description: Products which the User is using

data.description: 0 or more values of Users are returned

total.description: Total number of users in this Query

added_to_org.description: Date the user was added to the organization in ISO 8601 format.

accountIds.description: Unique ID of the users account. The format is [a-zA-Z0-9_|-:]{1,128}

items.description: Unique ID of the users account. The format is [a-zA-Z0-9_|-:]{1,128}

accountStatuses.description: The lifecycle status of the account

items.description: The lifecycle status of the account

isSuspended.description: Suspended users with no access. This is independent of the user account status

cursor.description: Starting point marker for page result retrieval

limit.description: The number of items to return. Default = max = 10000

expand.description:
Indicates the user information fields to include in the response. If unspecified, the response defaults to including only the accountId, accountType, and accountStatus fields.
The data for the product last access may be delayed by up to 24 hours.

items.description: Indicates the user information fields to include in the response. If unspecified, the response defaults to including only the accountId, accountType, and accountStatus fields.

accountId.description: Unique ID of the users account. The format is [a-zA-Z0-9_|-:]{1,128}

name.description: The display name of the user. Should be used for contextual rendering of the authorship in content. If the user has restricted visibility of their name, their nickname is displayed as a substitute value

nickname.description: The nickname of the user. Should be used for mentions or other in content references to the user.

accountStatus.description: The lifecycle status of the account

email.description: The email address of the user. The email will be absent for any user with an account_type of `app`

emailVerified.description: The email verification status of the user.

statusInUserbase.description: The status of the user in the userbase

PublicUser.description: The current page of search results

account_id.description:
Unique ID of the user's account that you are adding to the group.
Use the [Jira User Search API](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-users/#api-rest-api-3-users-search-get) to get the accountId (if Jira is available for your Organization). **Jira APIs use a different [authentication method ](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/basic-auth-for-rest-apis/).**
If you don’t have Jira, export a .csv of the user list. Learn how to [export users from a site](https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/export-users-from-a-site/).

groupIds.description: Unique ID that serves as reference to the group.

items.description: Unique ID that serves as reference to the group.

cursor.description: Cursor specifying the starting point for page result retrieval.

limit.description: The number of items to return. Default = max = 1000

expand.description: Indicates the user information fields to include in the response. If unspecified, the response defaults to id, name and description.

items.description: Indicates the user information fields to include in the response. If unspecified, the response defaults to id, name and description.

eq.description: The list of email domains to filter by, eg: for `abc@hello.com`, emailDomain is `hello.com`. Sample query param `{"emailDomains":{"eq":["hello.com"]}}`

items.description: The list of email domains to filter by

eq.description: The list of email usernames to filter by, eg: for `abc@hello.com`, emailUsername is `abc`. Sample query param `{"emailUsernames":{"eq":["abc"]}}`

items.description: The list of email usernames to filter by

eq.description: The list of group names to filter by

items.description: The list of group names to filter by

status.description: Verification Status of the Domain Claim

data.description: 0 or more values of Domain are returned

EventActorModel.description: The entity that performed the action

name.description: The display name of the Actor.

authType.description: The type of authentication used by the actor

tokenId.description: The id of the authentication token

onBehalfOf.description: The user the actor is acting on behalf of

name.description: The display name of the user the actor is acting on behalf of

email.description: The email of the user the actor is acting on behalf of

geo.description: Geo location of the IP address

countryName.description: Country location according to the IP address

regionName.description: Region location according to the IP address

city.description: City location according to the IP address

id.description: Unique identifier of the event object

time.description: The date and time of the event

action.description: Kind of Event. Complete list see `event-actions` API.

context.description: Describes one or more entities that the action was performed against. This field describes the "what" of the event.

container.description: Describes the location where the action was performed. This field describes the "where" of the event.

time.description: The date and time of the event.

processedAt.description: The date and time the event was processed.

action.description: The kind of event. Complete list see `event-actions` API.

context.description: Describes one or more entities that the action was performed against. This field describes the "what" of the event.

container.description: Describes the location where the action was performed. This field describes the "where" of the event.

list of resources Policy is associated with

page_size.description: Number of items in a page

SearchWorkspacesRequestV2.description: Workspaces request supporting enhanced Workspace searching.

cursor.description: A base-64 encoded continuation token used for pagination. When a cursor is provided in the request body, no other properties may be present.

QueryVariants.description: Possible operators/operand in the event query.

AndOperator.description: Returns workspaces matching all of the nested query variants. Absence of nested variants makes this operator no-op.

and.description: Returns workspaces matching all of the nested query variants. Absence of nested variants makes this operator no-op.

NorOperator.description: Returns workspaces excluding those that match any of the nested query variants. Absence of nested variants makes this operator no-op.

nor.description: Returns workspaces excluding those that match any of the nested query variants. Absence of nested variants makes this operator no-op

FieldOperand.description: Returns workspaces where a specified event field has one of the specified values. Absent of values makes this operator no-op.

field.description: Returns workspaces where a specified event field has one of the specified values.Absent of values makes this operator no-op.

searchWorkspaces.description: Returns workspaces, which partially contain the specified text in workspace name or url.

features.description: Returns workspaces, which contains feature listed

policies.description: Returns workspaces, which contains policy listed

applicationStatus.description: Status of policy application on resource

AllowIfContainedRule.description: Applicable when policy type is `ip-allowlist` or `data-residency`

content.description: Encrypted message of audit log activity

format.description: Format of the audit log message

alt.description: Alternate URL to fetch this resource

LinkSelfAltModel.description: Links for a resources with self and alternate links

alt.description: Alternate URL to fetch this resource

prev.description: URL to fetch the Previous Page

next.description: URL to fetch the Next Page

resource.description:
Use the [Get Workspaces API](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/rest/api-group-workspaces/#api-v2-orgs-orgid-workspaces-post) to get an id.
Only the following resources are valid:
- avp
- beacon
- bitbucket
- compass
- confluence
- jira-admin
- jira-core
- jira-software
- jira-servicedesk
- jira-product-discovery
- loom
- mercury
- opsgenie
- platform
- statuspage
- townsquare
- trello
- unified-help

role.description: Role to assign to a resource

id.description: A unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the error.

status.description: The HTTP status code applicable to this error.

code.description:
An application-specific error code:
  - `ADMIN-400-1`  - Invalid page cursor
  - `ADMIN-400-2`  - Invalid domain identifier
  - `ADMIN-400-3`  - Invalid time date
  - `ADMIN-400-4`  - Invalid resource
  - `ADMIN-400-24` - Invalid request body
  - `ADMIN-400-32` - Too many license breaches
  - `ADMIN-403-3`  - Not allowed to manage the org
  - `ADMIN-403-5`  - Not allowed to manage the group
  - `ADMIN-403-6`  - Not allowed to delete group with default-role attribute
  - `ADMIN-403-7`  - Not allowed to delete group which grants admin access to a product or org
  - `ADMIN-404-1`  - Unknown resource
  - `ADMIN-404-2`  - Organization not found
  - `ADMIN-404-3`  - Domain not found
  - `ADMIN-404-4`  - Event not found
  - `ADMIN-404-5`  - Policy not found
  - `ADMIN-404-8`  - User not found
  - `ADMIN-404-10` - Group not found
  - `ADMIN-405-1`  - Method not supported
  - `ADMIN-409-3`  - License limit exceeded
  - `ADMIN-409-5`  - Group not empty
  - `ADMIN-429-1`  - Rate limit exceeded
  - `ADMIN-500-1`  - Internal error

detail.description: Human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the error, and a suggested action to resolve it.

code.description: The HTTP status code applicable to this error.

status.description: The HTTP status code applicable to this error.

error.description: The HTTP status text applicable to this error.

Error.InvalidQueryCount.Model.description: The number of queries exceeded the limit

role.description: Role to assign/revoke for a user

resource.description:
Use the [Get Workspaces API](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/rest/api-group-workspaces/#api-v2-orgs-orgid-workspaces-post) to get an id.
Resource is required for all roles other than org-admin. Any resource passed for org-admin shall be ignored

id.description: A unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the error.

code.description: The code of the error. It can be one of the following values: - ADMIN-UAM-400-1: Bad Request - ADMIN-UAM-400-2: Inactive user - ADMIN-UAM-400-3: Invalid Role for Resource - ADMIN-UAM-400-4: Product not licensed - ADMIN-UAM-401-1: Unauthenticated - ADMIN-UAM-401-2: Unauthorized - ADMIN-UAM-403-1: Forbidden - ADMIN-UAM-403-2: Not allowed to manage the org - ADMIN-UAM-404-1: Unknown Resource - ADMIN-UAM-404-2: Organization not found - ADMIN-UAM-404-3: Group Not Found - ADMIN-UAM-405-1: Method Not Supported - ADMIN-UAM-409-1: Cannot create default group - ADMIN-UAM-409-2: Resource Conflicts - ADMIN-UAM-409-3: Product License Limit Exceeded - ADMIN-UAM-415-1: Unsupported Media Type - ADMIN-UAM-500-1: Internal Error

status.description: The HTTP status code applicable to this error.

detail.description: Human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the error, and a suggested action to resolve it.

accountId.description: Unique ID of the user's account.

addedToOrg.description: The ISO-8601 date and time the user was first added to the organization.

name.description: The full name of the user.

email.description: The email address of the user.

emailVerified.description: The email verification status of the user. If true, the user verified their email after  creating their account.

platformRoles.description: The admin role IDs of the user. The role IDs are used to determine the permissions of the user.

picture.description: The URL of the user's profile picture.

avatar.description: The URL of the user's public avatar.

roles.description: User counts associated with different role IDs.

accountStatus.description: User counts associated with different account statuses.

data.description: A page of user role assignments.

roles.description: The list of role IDs the user has for that resource ID.

data.description: A page of user directory information.

description.example: This group provides admin access to Jira.
This group provides admin access to Jira.

types.description: Group counts associated with different group types.

data.description: A page of group role assignments.

MultiDirectoryGroupRoleAssignment.description: The role assignment for the group.

roles.description: Contains a list of roles the group has for that resource ID.

ResourceOwner.description: The resource owner of the product.

ResourceId.description: The resource ID from the role assignment relationship. The resource ID is in the Atlassian  Resource Identifier (ARI) format.

RoleIds.description: A list of role IDs. The Atlassian canonical roles are used to determine the permissions of the user against resources within the organization.

ClaimStatus.description:
The claim status for the user account.
  - `managed` - Returns only managed accounts. For more on managed accounts: https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/what-are-managed-accounts/.
  - `unmanaged` - Returns only unmanaged accounts.

Status.description:
The status for the user account. This status is a composite of `accountStatus` and `membershipStatus`.
  - `active` - `accountStatus` is `active` and `membershipStatus` is `active`.
  - `suspended` - `accountStatus` is `active` and `membershipStatus` is `suspended`.
  - `not_invited` - `accountStatus` is `active` and `membershipStatus` is `no_membership`.
  - `deactivated` - `accountStatus` is `inactive`.

AccountStatus.description:
The lifecycle status of the account.
  - `active` - The account is active and can be used.
  - `inactive` - The account is inactive and doesn't have access to any resources.
  - `closed` - The account is closed and can't be used.

count.description: The number of accounts with the associated status.

MembershipStatus.description:
The membership status is the status of the user account in the organization.
  - `active` - the account has an active membership for one or more directories within the organization.
  - `suspended` - the account is suspended in all directories within the organization, to which the requestor has permission to access.
  - `no_membership` - the account is in none of the organization’s directories.

GroupCounts.description: The number of objects associated with the group.

users.description: The number of users that belong to the group.

resources.description: The number of resources the group has roles assigned to, linked to the  directories the requestor can manage.

RoleId.description:
The list of role IDs. The Atlassian canonical roles are used to determine the permissions of the user against resources within  the organization. The allowed roles are:
   - `atlassian/user` - Can access the product, with no product admin permissions
   - `atlassian/admin` - Can access the product, with product admin permissions
   - `atlassian/guest` - Can only access one space you or space admins specify
   - `atlassian/customer` - (Jira Service Management) Can visit help center, submit help requests, and view articles (non-billable)
   - `atlassian/user-access-admin` - No product access. Can administer users and groups for this product in Atlassian Administration
   - `atlassian/contributor` - Can access the product to view, comment, and vote only (non-billable)
   - `atlassian/basic` - Can access basic product features, with no product admin permissions (non-billable)
   - `atlassian/stakeholder` - Can receive incident updates and has the same product access as Customer. Non-billable but available only on Premium and Enterprise plans
   - `atlassian/org-admin` - An organization admin is the highest level of admin and can complete any administrative task in Atlassian Administration
   - `atlassian/site-admin` - Site admins can access Atlassian Administration and complete tasks related to the specific site they are administering.

count.description: The number of users with this role.

UserCounts.description: The number of objects associated with the user.

resources.description: The number of resources the user has roles assigned to, linked to the directories the requestor can manage.

count.description: The number of groups of this type in the organization.

GroupTotalCounts.description: Total group counts across the organization.

all.description: The total number of groups in the organization.

synced.description: The total number of groups that are synced with an identity provider.

LinkSelfCursor.description: Links for a resource with a self cursor, for use in a cursor parameter.

LinkPageCursor.description: Links for a paginated response, for use in a cursor parameter.

prev.description: Cursor to fetch the previous page.

next.description: Cursor to fetch the next page.

orgIdParam.name: orgId
orgIdParam.description: Your organization is identified by a Unique ID. You get your organization ID and Organization API key simultaneously.

accountIdParam.name: accountId
accountIdParam.description: Unique ID associated with a user account.

accountIdDirectoriesParam.name: accountId
accountIdDirectoriesParam.description: Filters the results to only the directories where the specified user is a member.

groupIdParam.name: groupId
groupIdParam.description: Unique ID associated with a group.

directoryIdParam.name: directoryId
directoryIdParam.description: Unique ID associated with a directory. The `-` character can be used to increase the operation scope  to all directories the requestor has permission to manage.

cursorParam.name: cursor
cursorParam.description: Sets the cursor position to retrieve the next set of results. If present, all other parameters are discarded when searching.

limitParam.name: limit
limitParam.description: The desired number of results for the search request.

accountIdsParam.name: accountIds
accountIdsParam.description: A list of user account IDs.

directoryIdsParam.name: directoryIds
directoryIdsParam.description: A list of directory IDs. The requestor must have permissions to  administer resources linked to these directories.

resourceOwnersParam.name: resourceOwners
resourceOwnersParam.description: The list of resource owners to filter the results by. Used to identify resources using their owner to which the user has at least one role assigned to.

resourceIdsParam.name: resourceIds
resourceIdsParam.description: A list of resource IDs. The resource IDs should be specified  using the Atlassian Resource Identifier (ARI) format. Example ARI: `ari:cloud:jira-core::site/1`

claimStatusParam.name: claimStatus
claimStatusParam.description:
The claim status for the user account. By default, both `managed` and `unmanaged` accounts are returned.
  - `managed` - Returns only managed accounts. For more on managed accounts: https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/what-are-managed-accounts/
  - `unmanaged` - Returns only unmanaged accounts.

statusParam.name: status
statusParam.description:
The status for the user account. This status is a composite of `accountStatus` and `membershipStatus`.
  - `active` - `accountStatus` is `active` and `membershipStatus` is `active`.
  - `suspended` - `accountStatus` is `active` and `membershipStatus` is `suspended`.
  - `not_invited` - `accountStatus` is `active` and `membershipStatus` is `no_membership`.
  - `deactivated` - `accountStatus` is `inactive`.

accountStatusParam.name: accountStatus
accountStatusParam.description:
The lifecycle status of the account.
  - `active` - The account is active and can be used.
  - `inactive` - The account is inactive and doesn't have access to any resources.
  - `closed` - The account is closed and can't be used.

membershipStatusParam.name: membershipStatus
membershipStatusParam.description:
A list of membership statuses. The membership status is the status of the user account in the organization.
  - `active` - the account has an active membership for one or more directories within the organization.
  - `suspended` - the account is suspended in ALL directories within the organization, to which the requestor has permission to access.
  - `no_membership` - the account is in NONE of the organization’s directories.

roleIdsParam.name: roleIds
roleIdsParam.description:
A list of role IDs. The Atlassian canonical roles are used to determine the permissions of the user against resources within  the organization. The allowed roles are:
   - `atlassian/user` - Can access the product, with no product admin permissions
   - `atlassian/admin` - Can access the product, with product admin permissions
   - `atlassian/guest` - Can only access one space you or space admins specify
   - `atlassian/customer` - (Jira Service Management) Can visit help center, submit help requests, and view articles (non-billable)
   - `atlassian/user-access-admin` - No product access. Can administer users and groups for this product in Atlassian Administration
   - `atlassian/contributor` - Can access the product to view, comment, and vote only (non-billable)
   - `atlassian/basic` - Can access basic product features, with no product admin permissions (non-billable)
   - `atlassian/stakeholder` - Can receive incident updates and has the same product access as Customer. Non-billable but available only on Premium and Enterprise plans
   - `atlassian/org-admin` - An organization admin is the highest level of admin and can complete any administrative task in Atlassian Administration
   - `atlassian/site-admin` - Site admins can access Atlassian Administration and complete tasks related to the specific site they are administering.

searchTermParam.name: searchTerm
searchTermParam.description: A search term to search the `nickname` and `email` fields.

searchTermDirectoriesParam.name: searchTerm
searchTermDirectoriesParam.description: A search term to search the `name` field.

searchTermGroupParam.name: searchTerm
searchTermGroupParam.description: A search term to search the `name` field.

emailDomainsParam.name: emailDomains
emailDomainsParam.description: The email domain to filter the results. The email domain will be used to search against the  account email domain. For example, get all users with the `@atlassian.com` or `@example.com` email domain.

userSortByParam.name: sortBy
userSortByParam.description: The field and direction to sort the results by. Currently, only a single field can be sorted by. If `null`, the default sorting will be used.

field.description: The name of the field to sort the results by.

direction.description: The direction to sort the results by.

groupCountsParam.name: counts
groupCountsParam.description: Whether to include counts of different objects associated with the group.

includeResources.description: Whether to include the number of resources associated with the group.

includeUsers.description: Whether to include the number of users associated with the group.

groupSortByParam.name: sortBy
groupSortByParam.description: The field and direction to sort the results by. Currently, only a single field can be sorted by. If `null`, the default sorting will be used.

field.description: The name of the field to sort the results by.

direction.description: The direction to sort the results by.
